title: Why can’t I set the font as default in Outlook?
content:
Go to Settings >View all Outlook settings > Compose and reply. Under Message format, set Compose messages in to HTML format. Set the font and size you want for the default. Select Save.

Fonty Fonts

title: "private" startup switch no longer opens FF in private browsing mode
content:
Hello,

For a long time, I was able to launch Firefox on Windows with the startup switch "-private" which would cause it to launch directly into private browsing mode. I used that in a few local scripts, and created a shortcut to the executable, with this path:

"C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe -private"

Just like that, it worked. Whether by shortcut, terminal command, or execution of a 3rd party script, that startup switch would always open a private browsing window. Until a few months ago, that is, when it suddenly stopped working. Rather than opening a private browsing window, it now does one of two things:

1. If FF was not already running, it opens FF to a tab showing a warning that I am not in private browsing, with a button I can click to launch a private browsing window. (see attached image) This tells me it recognized the startup switch, but...refused to honor it? 2. If a FF window is already open, it launches another (non-private) Firefox window, with no warning about not being in Private Browsing mode.

Was this an intentional change? Is that startup switch just not supported anymore? I tried a quick web search, but all I was finding were unhelpful suggestions like "right click on the FF icon" and "pin to start." Not what I'm looking for.

Thank you!
creator: Figure8565

title: Curiosity - tracked despite private bowsing, VPN, and manual browsing data wipe
content:
Hello, I have a curiosity question, related to privacy. I recently found that eBay was able to confidently identify me when I would not have expected. By the way, I work in tech, often dealing with security and basic privacy. I am well aware of "fingerprinting," but typically that is used to break up people into subsets, or cohorts, not individually identify the user. And of course, even when it does, it typically won't show/tell the user that it has successfully done so. Anyway, here's what happened:

1. I visited eBay using FF's "Private browsing" in "Strict" mode, over a VPN connecting to country "alpha". This was running directly on the host OS of Windows 10, with a non-default (but common) window size, and one very common browser plugin. eBay marked me as belonging to the country of my VPN endpoint, and set the region and currency accordingly. 2. I close the private browsing window, change VPN endpoint to country "beta", and re-connect to eBay. It still recognizes the previous region settings, even though my VPN endpoint is in a different country. Thinking maybe cookies were not wiped until the browser session was completely terminated, I go a little further; 3. Close all browsing tabs, go to settings, and manually clear all data (cookies, cache, etc.). Change VPN endpoint again. 4. Connect to eBay again. It still recognizes me. Note that I have not changed any other signals about the session. Browser window size has not changed, still the same OS, the same browser version, the same browser plugin. I did these tests in quick succession, which could also be a signal to them. But this session did not carry a cookie, and was coming from a different IP address. All cached data had been cleared (supposedly, at least).

Is eBay's fingerprinting just that good, that they actually identify me individually, without a cookie and coming from halfway around the world? Or is there some other tracker or signal they are able to follow me with, to re-identify me?

I was running FF on a transparent virtualization layer, so I just wiped all data stored by FF since the testing started, switched to another VPN endpoint, and just like that, eBay had no idea who I was again. But why didn't FF's Private browsing, or the built-in data wipe (cookies & cache) de-identify me? It can't see it having been advanced fingerprinting, or it would have seen through me wiping the virtualization layer.

Thank you!
creator: Figure8565

title: I permessi dei file che scarico vengono corrotti da Firefox.
content:
Ciao a tutti,

ho scoperto oggi che su tanti computer con Windows 10 quando scarico con firefox un qualsiasi file questo ha i permessi corrotti. Infatti Windows non lo esegue se si tratta di un eseguibile. Se vado su proprietà del file con tasto destro del mouse > Proprietà da Esplora File e poi mi sposto sulla scheda Sicurezza mi compare scirtto: "Le autorizzazioni per nomeFile.exe sono ordinate in modo errato. Alcune voci potrebbero non essere abilitate.".

Finchè sono file pdf o documenti in word va tutto bene, però i file eseguibili non li esegue e devo mettermi a cambiare i permessi a questi file. Perchè sono negati per quasi tutti gli utenti e i gruppi e ci sono dei gruppi e degli utenti che non avevo mai visto e sarebbero: "NULL SID" e "NESSUNO".

La versione di Firefox che uso è 91.9.1 esr installata senza privilegi di amministrazione e configurata usando policies.json nella cartella distribution, è stata distribuita su tutti i computer con Windows 10, molte persone hanno accesso a questi computer, il mio PC che ha la stessa versione e pochi altri non hanno questo problema, cosa può essere successo? Firefox è stato infettato? Ho messo anche alcune password rischio che siano compromesse?

Grazie.
creator: DumbYarpi

Forum helper

Review the information below. Hope it helps 

                    Where do I find Firefox notifications

Go to the FFox settings - select "Settings" on the left > click on

title: Strange problem uploading images
content:
A very strange problem uploading images to Facebook and also to a forum from my desktop produces a washed out image. If I upload the same image file to the same location from another computer (laptop) it looks completely normal.

I am running latest build freshly installed of Firefox (did this as part of trouble shooting). I tried it on Firefox ESR and it still did it. Version is 121.0 64 bit.

Both Facebook and the forum save a compressed version of the image, I have copied the original and downloaded version from the forum below. The forum version has increased in size but the histogram has changed, They are both tagged sRGB so it doesn't appear to be a color management issue.

I tried uploading the same file from my desktop using edge browser and this worked fine. It is only the combination of my desktop and Firefox that has this problem and it has the issue in two places so far Facebook and on online forum I frequent. Uploads to Google drive are working fine.

Does anyone have any thoughts on what the issue might be? - it is clearly connected to Firefox which seems to be triggering something in the forum software and in Facebook, that does not occur from the laptop as I can upload things from edge browser just fine. Firefox should just deliver the image to the new location I would think???

title: No Comments from TownHall VIP Membership
content:
I run Firefox 121.0 on Windows 10 Pro. I use a VPN (ExpressVPN) and normally run Ghostery and uBlock Origin. When I log onto Townhall.com and enter my VIP credentials all is fine. However, when I read an article I should be able to access the comments. I cannot in Firefox and this is something that has occurred about 3-4 weeks ago. For years I have not had any problem like this with Firefox.

I tested VIP access with my iPhone - works fine. I tried Vivaldi - works fine. I tried Chrome - works fine. I try Firefox - fails!

I ran Firefox in "TroubleShoot" mode, with all add-ons turned off and it also fails. Even when I run Vivaldi I have Ghostery and ad blocking turned on, but Ghostery does allow townhall.com on their whitelist.

I've send emails to Townhall.com and am not getting any responses. However, I was having the issue with all devices but all have been fixed except with Firefox. So, I have no idea why this is an issue with Firefox but not with any other device.

Any thoughts?
creator: BPaul_H

title: Trojan:HTML/Phish!pz
content:
Below are communication I have had with both Glarysoft Support and Hideaway VPN by Firetrust Limited. I have narrowed the issue of detection of Trojan:HTML/Phish!pz by MS Defender While running Glary Utilities. (see screenshot).

Jeremy, Thank you for your rapid response. I connected to 3 different VPN servers, and used the link you provided (https://user-support.firetrust.com/Tickets/Reply/36314) below via Firefox, Chrome, and Edge. Connections to Seattle, Dallas, and Washington DC all produced the same result as before ONLY with Firefox. The issue WAS NOT reproduced by Chrome or Edge. title: Unable to redeem Microsoft rewards since late June.
content:
The title says it all. Microsoft writes back stating no voip phones, no VPN, no multiple users, no searching in multiple markets. I do NONE of those things, and NEVER have. I have a feeling it is somehow in my Firefox settings, although they are not looking amiss to me; or perhaps when my cellular company went to full time 5G (Google Pixel 6;) it is US Cellular (USA) and I've never had a problem before.

I get all of the way to the confirmation screen (with my phone number.) When I click it says "there is a problem with my account of ofer."

I got a new to me laptop in February, and about a month later windows 11 was auto downloaded. I use Ublock Origin, and Privacy Possum (they were never a problem prior to June) and have disabled them to try to redeem. I have tried with Chrome, Edge, and Bing on Firefox, on my PC. Bing on Firefox, and Chrome on my phone. I talked to Google, US Cellular, and (my ISP) Spectrum; all say they do not have settings which would cause the problem. I am at my wits end, many other folks are complaining of this too. Please help.
creator: newsie2000
